newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: INSTANT VIEW - Malaysia August trade data.
newsitem.headline: INSTANT VIEW - Malaysia August trade data.

text.p: Following is a selection of analysts' reactions to Malaysia trade surplus of August of 600.7 million ringgit.
The August data swung from a deficit of 614.97 million ringgit in July.
STEPHEN WELLER, DIRECTOR OF STRATEGY AY PESAKA JARDINE FLEMING:
"It is bucking the poor export trend around the region. It should silence the critics in the short term."
LUM CHEE SOON, CHIEF ECONOMIST PHILEO ALLIED SECURITIES:
"This monthly volatility will continue, and we are not too worried by it. It will help the trade balance at year's end. It is generally what we expected."
"It's on the dot (with expectations). Our concern is, we're expecting big ticket items like planes, to later bring it down to a deficit, but right now it's a bullish trend.
LIEW YIN SZE, CHIEF ECONOMIST, J.M. SASSOON:
"A surplus is always good news. It does signify that it is very much in line with our current account deficit of 14.7 billion for the year."
GHAZALI ATAN, SENIOR ECONOMIST, MBF ASSET MANAGEMENT:

"Overall, it looks good. It's well above my optimistic forecasts made early this year. A weak yen and moderation in investments are the two factors leading to the numbers. At this rate, I think the overall balance of payment deficit for this year will drop to 13.5 billion ringgit (from 18 billion last year)."
